website_summaries.verdict: For iPad-toting photographers looking for a simple compact shoulder bag, definitely put the Think Tank Retrospective 7 on your short list.
pros: The lightweight, well-built Think Tank Retrospective 7 is a good-looking midsize camera bag with flexible storage space and a separate padded pocket for an 11-inch laptop or tablet
cons: The bottom of the Retrospective 7 isn't very protected from water and wear and the bag has no small, zippered external pockets

customer_reviews.title: An Awesome Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag. Super durable, subtle style, develops nice wear marks, and the best pocket setup I've seen in a small bag. I have an Olympus EM5 MK II, Olympus 17mm f1.8, Olympus 45mm f1.8, Olympus 60mm f2.8 macro, a Rode VideoMicro, a hard SD card case, a couple filters, and a Thinktank battery holder (fits 2 batteries), and this bag is a bit too much for me. I returned mine, but I highly recommend it to someone who has a DSLR or larger mirrorless camera. For me, the Retrospective 5 is enough.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Fidgeting as with all camera bags.....
customer_reviews.text: After fidgeting awhile I finally struck on a packing system that worked for me. It is narrow and tight yet it can handle my equipment with ease and my "PLUS" items (non-camera gear). This bag is heavier than the City Walkers and near the same as the Urban Disguise bags but somewhat 'stylish' if you are tired of the same old black colored bags. The straps are about the most robust of Think Tanks line. Yes I am a Think Tank Fanboy. Have had Tamrac, Lowepro and others and tend to stay with what currently works for me and my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, but don't overload it.
customer_reviews.text: This bag looks great, has the subtle vibe that the ThinkTank products generally offer. Doesn't look like you've got an expensive camera at the ready. Packs up great, perfect for around town or a vacation. Handled my D700 with Nikon 28-70mm f. 2.8 (should handle the 24-70 well also). Only real concern: if you pack it up with photo gear, it gets mighty heavy for one shoulder. Best performance for weight bearing was strapping around shoulder/neck, bag on back/rump, which doesn't exactly give the low-profile one would like. Should probably have a backpack style bag for the weight of gear that I carry.
customer_reviews.author: David Cain

customer_reviews.title: My second bag to purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love that it does not look like a camera bag. I put a Canon 70d with an 18-35mm lens and hood attached, and it fit perfectly. in the side I can carry my 50mm 1.8 and the other my flash. Tons of pockets and areas for my extra batteries, cardt, etc. I can also fit a portable usb charger on the side pocket that is on the outside. I absolutely love the sound silencer for the velcro if you don't want it to make that sound every time you open it. I did tons of research before buying, as I do with everything. Just get it, you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chapin

customer_reviews.title: A Beautiful, Functional Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag keeps it's shape, solidly protects, looks and feels great...it's just a winner. This is my second one since I had to move up in size after building my lens set-up. My camera and three lenses fit comfortably and well-protected in the bag. It's broad strap makes carrying the bag comfortable. A 10!
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Nakell

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, incognito!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bag. Construction and materials are top-notch--looks and feels durable. it appears to offer sufficient protection for my camera gear. I got the Retro 7, and it fits my slr with 24-70 lens attached (face down), with enough room for two more lenses on either side. I also like the padded shoulder strap with no-slip adhesive. It makes carrying easier. The bag itself is heavy though. Consider that when packing in all your equipment for travelling.
customer_reviews.author: anton

customer_reviews.title: Think Tank Photo Retrospective 7 - Pinestone
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a compact bag to replace the bag that came with my DJI Mavic Pro & to store the drone & its accessories when I want to bring them on the go. The Think Tank Perspective 7 answered this need. Its a soft sided bag that is compact but is spacious enough to hold my gear. The exterior design is very simple & has has enough compartments & dividers to separate out the accessories of my DJI Mavic Pro. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: parokyaniedgar

customer_reviews.title: All it promised
customer_reviews.text: Took this with my Canon 5diii, 17-40, 24-105, 40 pankake, batteries, memory cards, Kindle reader, and a paper notebook for a 3 week trip. There was enough space left for more even with that. This has about the most comfortable shoulder strap of any bag I've used (and I have many). Easy, comfortable, roomy, durable and protected my gear well. I'd recommend this to anybody. The only "downside" was that the outside pocket really are too small for a water bottle and I don't like keeping one inside the bag in case the bottle leaks (but it would fit). Not a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Packer

customer_reviews.title: A Fine Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: Travelled with this bag to Guatemala, Turkey and Paris. Looks the same as the day I bought it. Fit nicely under the seat while flying. I use it to carry my Nikon D800, 16-35mm and 24-70mm lenses, assorted filters, memory cards, charger, rain bag and BlackRapid Kick Camera Strap (highly recommend.) Plenty of pocket space for miscellaneous stuff. Bag offers a fair amount of padding, but not a lot. I doubled up some of the padding and used it on the bottom of the case. Always carry this bag across my chest to distribute weight. I'm a pretty small person, so this bag works well for me. It's a good looking, sturdy shoulder bag that doesn't scream camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag if you want this size. I only own the Panasonic GH5 and a couple of lenses at this time. I wanted a bag that I could carry that plus my Rode VideoMic Pro, Zoom H1, Manfrotto Mini Tripod etc and this bag was the right size. Think Tank makes great camera bags so it's hard to go wrong with any size you get.
customer_reviews.author: Paris Tx Guy

customer_reviews.title: Quality bag
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of this bag and it is quite functional as well. Definitely more on the manly side, though I've been told it looks like a diaper bag -- a dad's diaper bag at least. Caveats: It doesn't work well with a 70-200mm attached, you have to lay the camera down horizontally and even then the fit is awkward (I believe they make a larger bag though). It also doesn't really fit a 13" macbook air. You can get it into the laptop pocket but its too long and you cannot zip the pocket closed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Best all round bag I've every used!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is fantastic! Lightweight, soft, awesome wide shoulder strap. Plus several pockets in and out that just simply work perfect. I also have the Retrospective 5 when I am traveling light, it's equally as good. The 7 is perfect for my Fuji XT-1 with 4 extra lenses. When I only need to take two extra lenses I take the Retrospective 5.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Williams

customer_reviews.title: a great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. it fits EVERYTHING including my camera gear (which, i admit, isn't a lot. three lenses, main body, and battery charger), ipad, phone, wallet, water bottle, keys, etc. and i also have a fujifilm instaxx camera in there. its comfortable to wear, durable, i dont mind putting it down on the floor because its canvas and its perfect for me because i tend to change lens a lot so i like that this is accessible.
customer_reviews.author: thenjbookworm

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what else can you say about this bag that hasn't already been said. The build is great and it is not too big where it would look funny carrying around. Yes, my IPad Air fits in the back area of the bag and my IPad is in a case. I'm sure this bag will last years and the Pinestone color is perfect to blend in at the shops or walking around town
customer_reviews.author: William J. M

customer_reviews.title: and feel of the bag are wonderful. But this bag is not comfortable to use ...
customer_reviews.text: The construction, look, and feel of the bag are wonderful. But this bag is not comfortable to use all day. Its heavy empty. Its heavy with a Olympus OM-D E-M5 II with an extra lens.
customer_reviews.author: P. Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Perfect day-bag for my Mamiya 7 (2 lenses +1 attached).
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Others have described it in more detail. They're all correct. Loads of pockets for stuff. Enough room to perfectly fit my Mamiya 7 system, 150mm, 80mm either side and 65mm attached to camera in the middle. 2 or 3 filters in boxes at the bottom of the middle compartment. Film and light meter in front pocket. Perfect day-bag for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bunkles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I started looking for a new bag when I noticed I was leaving my over-filled camera backpack at home more often than taking it with me. I chose the Retrospective 7 and I'm completely satisfied with my choice. In it I pack my 70D with a 24-105 L attached, a 70-300 and a speed light. Throw in some extra batteries, my light meter, an iPad and some other miscellaneous accessories...I feel like I'm "almost" ready for anything and more importantly, I actually carry this on a daily basis. Build quality is fabulous! Has more style than I do.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this product 100 pluses Don't even get me started on the Pros. But there still is 1 single con: it's heavy. It isn't the case when you try it on, but when you wear it whole day - you realize: it's heavy. Nevertheless, highly recommend to anyone, it's a great bag!!!
customer_reviews.author: OlegTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! The material feels nice. The pine stone green is a gorgeous neutral color. Lots of inner pockets & storage. It’s the perfect size for a body, 3-4 lenses, extra batteries & flash.
customer_reviews.author: 3lilmunkeez

customer_reviews.title: Top notch!
customer_reviews.text: Quality of these bags are second to none. I love them. I didn't realize that when I ordered and received, I actually received the think tank 5 instead of the 7. Ha. My fault for not realizing it at the time, so I won't take any stars away from it. =) Will always be my favorite bags! They're so comfy and really begin to mold to your style and shape.
customer_reviews.author: jered overton

customer_reviews.title: Such a wonderful camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Such a wonderful camera bag. It is small enough to carry around but provides excellent space. I can easily fit my D750, 15-30, 24-70, and 70-200. The quality and texture of this bag always get such praise from others and feels great too. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The best over the shoulder camera bag I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: This is a real keeper, I usually bring my Think Tank Streetwalker with me when shooting but I wanted to have a smaller shoulder bag that would have an extra lens, my D700 grip, it's batteries and other camera add ons I could carry with walking around festivals or grab and go places. This bag is perfect for that. I highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag, zero compromises
customer_reviews.text: Such a well thought out and designed bag, it's perfect for DSLR photographers and videographers alike. Fits my Canon 5DIII with 24-105 attached, a Tamron 70-300 (the Canon 70-200 might be a bit big for this bag), and Rokinon 14mm. Comfortable padded strap and high quality materials and plenty of room for knick-knacks, I'm not sure I have any cons for this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bag.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is beautiful. The quality is perfect. I’ve been using it for a few years now and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: great for mirrorless with big lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, lightweight and stylish. Lots of pockets to store not just gears but few personal things so you keep everything in one place. I went for the Retro 7 hoping to fit my A7s with a 70-200 lens (SEL70200G) mounted and it barely reach the bag top when stored vertically. I definitely recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano SD

customer_reviews.title: Makes our job so easy!
customer_reviews.text: We should have order it a long time ago! Makes our job so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Gyorgy Papp

customer_reviews.title: Returned this but will be ordering again soon.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this for the smaller 5 version, but thinking about it now I should have kept it for my Mamiya C330 Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Noll

customer_reviews.title: Exag
customer_reviews.text: First time I have purchased a Think Tank product and am very pleased. It is well constructed and stylish. It hold my D300s, 14-24mm, 24-70mm and my 70-200mm lens, plus many filters and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the best all around camera bag I own. Superb quality and thoughtful design. High praise from a working pro with 30 years experience. I have about 20+ bags in my studio.
customer_reviews.author: Imagica, LLC Perry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Think Photo gear
customer_reviews.text: This is a great day bag for my photo gear. When I'm not out hiking, this is my go to bag for city and urban photos.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Get this bag!
customer_reviews.text: The Retro 7 is everything I hoped it would be and more. It comfortably fits my Canon with 24-70mm attached and next to it a 70-200mm. It has a very slim profile even fully loaded and lots of extra pockets and storage areas. High quality fabric and build: definitely recommended. Go ThinkTank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bag
customer_reviews.text: this is a wonderful bag for my OMD EM-5 camera all 6 lenses, FL-600R flash, and other sundry camera supplies. It also has room for the manuals and a small point and shoot. I use this bag for storing all of my camera gear. It would be too large as a camera day bag where I'm only carrying the EM-5 and 2-3 lenses with the point and shoot. For a day bag I will probably use the ThinkTank Retro 5 or the new mirrorless bag from Think Tank. I'm very pleased with the overall build and utility of the bag and the Pinestone fabric is a nice departure from black.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Felter

customer_reviews.title: It is the perfect size for a city camera bag and it does ...
customer_reviews.text: It is the perfect size for a city camera bag and it does not appear to be so. Therefore, I can bring a camera without looking like a tourist to my home city.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Predmore

customer_reviews.title: Over priced as most bags are but recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for some months. Lots of pockets to sort equipment. Over priced as most bags are but recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SDG

customer_reviews.title: good, sturdy bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made bag and worth it if you own expensive or inexpensive equipment. It's a little on the bulky side and tends to fall forward so just be aware of that. It's my go-to bag.
customer_reviews.author: SuperJFly

customer_reviews.title: Great for Leica and DSLR
customer_reviews.text: My favourite walk around bag to carry my DSLR and Leica.
customer_reviews.author: www.MokhtarChahine.com

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great! It looks small Canon 5D III w 27-70 70-200 mm 2.8 vr II, 50mm 1.2f 85mm 1.2f can put into this small bag
customer_reviews.author: Klee Yio

customer_reviews.title: For me, the perfect size, function and styling.
customer_reviews.text: Of two bags and a backpack I have, this is the one I take all the time. The functionality and workmanship is first class. It has that not too big, casual retro look I been looking for and it is actually comfortable on my shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Taun Deverill

customer_reviews.title: Professional Quality - Highly Functional
customer_reviews.text: This bag was everything I was looking for. Extremely well built like all ThinkTank products. Very comfortable even on a long shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kent

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this bag. It has been a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark golbach

customer_reviews.title: perfect camera bag!
customer_reviews.text: i love my new think tank retrospective 7. perfect for my d7000 with 3 lenses, and my p300 compact. it has lots of pockets for storage, and is made from tough material. it comes with a shower resistant cover. you can tell they really thought about what a dslr user expects from their camera bag before producing it. nice and lightweight as well, and it even fits my ipad. i can't believe how good this bag is. perfect for travel photography.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag for a full size DSLR and a couple of lenses and accessories. Excellent construction and best of all Made in America! Great choice for a camera bag and comfortable to carry. Plenty of pockets including on to fit a full size iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: felt cheap
customer_reviews.text: its 'cute' i guess, it tries to offer a ridiculous amount of functionality, not all that well executed imo... over the years I've come to realize a Billingham Hadley/Hadley Pro is the best bag for me, simplicity that just works, I like the ONA bags as well, Prince Street is a nice sub for my hadley when the occasion calls for it.
customer_reviews.author: Gibby
